skill.name: coordinating-projects
skill.description: Automatically activated when user mentions multi-project coordination, cross-project dependencies, portfolio management, roadmap planning, resource allocation across projects, or asks to coordinate/manage multiple projects simultaneously. Provides strategic project coordination expertise.

skill.author: C0ntr0lledCha0s

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing no executable code. Provides strategic project coordination expertise through guidance and frameworks. All capabilities (GitHub CLI commands, template file operations, agent delegation) are documented and consistent with the stated purpose.

content.value_statement: Managing multiple projects creates coordination complexity, conflicting priorities, and resource conflicts. This skill provides strategic frameworks for portfolio management, dependency mapping, and cross-project coordination to align work with business objectives.
actual_capabilities: Map dependencies across multiple projects and identify critical paths
Create quarterly and annual roadmaps aligned with strategic objectives
Allocate team resources efficiently across competing projects
Coordinate cross-project releases with sequencing and risk mitigation
Monitor portfolio health and identify at-risk projects early
Apply frameworks like OKR, Now-Next-Later, and theme-based planning
limitations: Provides guidance and recommendations only, does not execute project management tasks directly
Requires GitHub CLI or similar tools for data gathering operations
Cannot access external systems beyond the current project context
Delegates execution to other agents like workflow-orchestrator

use_cases.title: Strategic Portfolio Planning
use_cases.description: Align multiple team projects with company OKRs, balance strategic initiatives with maintenance work, and create quarterly roadmaps.

use_cases.title: Cross-Project Dependencies
use_cases.description: Identify and track dependencies between projects, sequence work to unblock critical paths, and coordinate releases.

use_cases.title: Resource Optimization
use_cases.description: Optimize team allocation across projects, prevent burnout from over-allocation, and plan capacity for upcoming work.

prompt_templates.title: Quarterly Roadmap
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a quarterly roadmap for [time period] based on our company goals: [goals]. We have these active projects: [list projects] with these team resources: [describe teams].

prompt_templates.title: Dependency Map
prompt_templates.prompt: Map dependencies between our projects: [list projects and their relationships]. Identify critical path and suggest sequencing to unblock work.

prompt_templates.title: Release Coordination
prompt_templates.prompt: Coordinate the release of [list projects]. Identify dependencies between them and create a phased rollout plan with risk mitigation.

prompt_templates.title: Resource Allocation
prompt_templates.prompt: We have [number] engineers and these projects: [list projects with priorities]. Recommend allocation to balance delivery with sustainability.

output_examples.input: Create Q2 roadmap for our 3 microservices projects with 8 engineers
output: Strategic theme alignment: Enterprise features (40%), Performance (30%), Technical debt (20%), Security (10%)
Dependency map showing critical path: Auth Service â†’ API Gateway â†’ Frontend
Resource allocation: 4 engineers on critical path, 2 on parallel work, 2 on support
Milestone timeline: April (50% complete), May (80% complete), June (100%)
Risk mitigation: Feature flags, rollback plan, staged rollout

best_practices: Document dependencies early before they become blockers in sprint execution
Keep roadmaps as living documents and update based on learnings and changing priorities
Allocate 10% buffer capacity for unknowns to avoid chronic over-allocation
anti_patterns: Starting projects without mapping dependencies creates hidden blockers that delay delivery
Allocating 100% team capacity leads to burnout and inability to handle unexpected issues
Treating all projects as equal priority means nothing gets the resources it needs

faq.question: What tools does this skill integrate with?
faq.answer: Works with GitHub CLI for project data, delegates to workflow-orchestrator for execution, and creates roadmap files in .claude-project/ directories.

faq.question: How many projects can this skill manage?
faq.answer: No hard limit. The skill scales by identifying dependencies, critical paths, and resource constraints regardless of portfolio size.

faq.question: Can this skill replace a project manager?
faq.answer: No. The skill provides strategic frameworks and recommendations. Human judgment is required for stakeholder negotiation and organizational decisions.

faq.question: Is data sent to external services?
faq.answer: No. All operations stay within the project context. GitHub CLI calls go directly to GitHub APIs configured in your environment.

faq.question: Why is my project not activating this skill?
faq.answer: Mention keywords like roadmap, resource allocation, multiple projects, cross-project dependencies, or OKRs. The skill activates on these triggers.

faq.question: How does this differ from sprint planning skills?
faq.answer: Sprint planning focuses on 1-2 week execution within a single project. This skill coordinates across multiple projects over months with strategic alignment.
